ship.help: Fetch data on a specific ship
ship.help_ex:
`[ship]` entry can be an `alias`. Input is case-insensitive. Calling with different aliases have the following effects:
-Calling with `s`, `c` or `ship` will land you on the profile page.
-Calling with `stats` will land you on the stats page.
-Calling with `pic` or `gallery` will land you on the gallery page.

The emotes at the bottom of the embed enable you to navigate between the pages. The arrows allows you to navigate between images, should there be more than 1.

Examples:
`.bo s lefan` `.bo pic eugen` `.bo stats mary`

alias.help: View/search/modify aliases. See `.bo help aliases` for more details
alias.help_ex:
Syntax is as follows:
`.bo alias`
Display all recorded aliases.

`.bo alias [ship/alias]`
Enter a `ship` to see all aliases attached to the ship, or enter an `alias` to see who the alias is pointing to.

`.bo alias add [alias] -> [ship]`
`.bo alias edit [alias] -> [ship]`
`.bo alias delete [alias]`
In all cases you may not modify a master alias.

help.help: use this to see extended documentation. [command] should not be an alias and should omit the `.bo` prefix

update.help: Use this to fetch and update ship data from the wiki. See `.bo help update`.
update.help_ex:
Options are: `all` `ships` `[ship]` `index`.
`index` option will only update the index. This is done via the Senki page on the wiki.
`ships` will update all ships in index but does not update index itself.
`[ship]` option will only update the profile for a specific ship. Index will not be updated.
`all` option will update the index and then attempt to fetch information for all ships in the index.
`--sheet` option will try to suppliment ship data with that from the spreadsheet first. Fields will be overwritten by the wiki should the data be available.

reload_sheet.help: Grabs data off the spreadsheet. Is quite unstable. See `.bo help reload_sheet`.
reload_sheet.help_ex: Only supported sheet at the moment is `skills_jp`. May extend to other sheets first but the GoogleSheets API is quite troublesome to work with.

oil.help: See the current oil reminder settings on the server or set them for the server. Will notify when daily oil collection will be available. See `.bo help oil` for more details.
oil.help_ex:
If the command is called with no inputs, it will show the current settings for the server. To use subcommands, you must have the [admin] perm.

`.bo oil set [*options]`
Set parameters for the oil reminder function. Inputs are `active`, `channel`, `role`. No more than 3 inputs will be accepted.
`active` must be either `0` or `1` for inactive and active respectively.
`channel` must be an actual `#discord-channel`.
`role` must be an actual `@discord-role`.
The three input types can entered in any order.
**Note: if `role` is not set but `active` is set to 1, the reminder will be sent anyway but without the mention. Also, no reminders will be sent if `channel` is invalid.**

`.bo oil reset [*options]`
If called with no options, all fields will be reset. Inputs are `role`, `channel`. No more than  2 inputs will be accepted.
`.bo oil reset channel`
Resets the channel.
`.bo oil reset role`
Resets the role.
The inputs can be entered in any order. If you want to reset `active`, use `.bo oil set 0` instead.
